For a guy who runs the tortured-male network, FX's Landgraf has the most chill speaking manner of any TV exec. #tca

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) August 6, 2011

It's Often Overcast in Sudbury #fxcanadashows

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) August 6, 2011

I will say this: the SOA panel still looks like it could kick the ass of every panel here in the last 14 days.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) August 6, 2011

Instead of answering bad TCA questions, "Sons of Anarchy" cast answers by saying, "You've been here a real long time, haven't you?"#TCAs11

— Roger Catlin (@rcatlin) August 6, 2011

Did not expect the "American Horror Story" to start with @HitFixDaniel asking a font question. Ryan Murphy actually giving an answer

If TV critics don't respect our media enough not to ask "Why drop down to TV?" questions, who will? #tcas11

"I'd never had a man promise me so much," Lange says of Ryan Murphy. Aw. They're in love. #tcas11

Connie Britton couldn't watch Nip/Tuck because it was "too gory," has seen enough of Glee to know it was "innovative." Me: It's Mrs. Coach!

(Subtext of current panel: Nobody wants to be the person who asks Ryan Murphy about GLEE. Nobody thinks that's going to be fun.) #tcas11

Dylan McDermott says American Horror Story in the vein of Polanski films. OK, that's a step too far.

"I should not be here." - Connie Britton on the fact she's scared of scary movies. Oh, honey, it goes beyond that. You shouldn't be in this.
